name: Paneer Dumplings
instructions: Take crushed Paneer in a bowl.
Add Salt and a touch of Chilli Flakes.
Add Starch to ensure the mixture binds together beautifully and becomes nice and crisp on the outside.
Mix all of this together.
Press the mixture down and pinch marble-sized balls.
Press, roll, and slowly release the pressure to form a little dumpling which is almost crevice-free.
Shape the Paneer Dumplings and get them ready.
Fry the dumplings on high flame to bring in a layer of colour.
Stir the dumplings frequently to avoid brown spots.
Once fried, transfer the dumplings to an absorbent tissue paper to drain the excess oil.
Set aside the fried dumplings.

name: Herbed Rice
ingredients: Parboiled Rice (long grain or short grain, your choice)
instructions: Begin with Salted Butter in a pan.
Before the butter begins to melt, add Chilli Flakes, Oregano, lots of Coriander Leaves, and a touch of Salt.
Add Parboiled Rice to the mixture (long grain or short grain, as per your choice).
If you've added Salt while cooking the rice, use additional Salt with caution.
Move all of this around and quickly flavour the rice with Butter, Herbs, and Spices.
Once the rice is tossed and reheated, turn off the flame.

name: Chilli Gravy
ingredients: Dark Sauce of your choice (Dark Soya, Light Soya, Hunan, Oyster, etc.)
instructions: Begin by adding Water to a bowl.
Add a Dark Sauce of your choice (it could be Dark Soya, Light Soya, Hunan, Oyster, etc.).
Add Corn Starch, Tomato Ketchup, Chilli Flakes (to your preferred level of heat), Sugar (for sweetness), and just a touch of Salt.
Remember that the sauces used may already contain Salt, so adjust accordingly.
Quickly whisk all of this together to create a flavoured slurry.
In a pan, heat Oil and add Petals of Onions.
Immediately follow with Yellow Peppers.
Stir-fry the onions and bell peppers on high flame until done.
Transfer the stir-fried vegetables to a bowl.
In the same pan, add the flavoured slurry (stirring or whisking once again for at least 30 seconds to ensure the Corn Starch is evenly distributed).
Cook the slurry, allowing it to thicken and develop shine and gloss.
Once the gravy is done, set it aside.

name: Chilli Paneer Rice Bowl
instructions: Ensure that the Butter Rice or the Herb Rice is steaming hot.
Make sure the Chilli Gravy or curry is absolutely piping.
Refresh the Paneer Dumplings by either microwaving, refrying, or using an air fryer (the choice is yours).
Bring all components together in a platter or a bowl.
Plate the dish and enjoy as a family.
